original_title: Congress registers resounding victory in 2023 Karnataka Election
original_body_lines: The Congress won 136 seats securing a decisive victory in the 2023 Karnataka assembly election.
The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) with 65 seats, lost power, leading Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai to resign, after conceding defeat before the final results were announced.
The next CM is expected to be Siddaramaiah or DK Shivakumar.
Exit polls predicted a close race, with Congress emerging as the largest party but falling short of the majority.
The voter turnout in Karnataka was 73.19% in a single-phase election.
